elements.title: Boghead (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that local folklore links Boghead (ruins pictured), a Northumbrian bastle house, to the story of Barty Milburn, an accomplished swordsman and killer of Scots?

elements.title: Adolf Real (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Adolf Real was re-elected as Mayor of Vaduz in 1900, but he refused to take the office?

elements.title: Velký vlastenecký výlet (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a crew member of the film Velký vlastenecký výlet walked out after a protagonist justified rape?

elements.title: Angela Pack (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that periodontist Angela Pack called the Dental Council board "lily-livered chickens" for hesitating to allow training of dental hygienists in New Zealand?

elements.title: European Geniza (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the "books within books" of the European Geniza are a collection of manuscript fragments recovered from medieval and early-modern book bindings?

elements.title: Bob Barrabee (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bob Barrabee studied tobacco farming in Cuba and played in the NFL in the same year?

elements.title: Our Lady of the Holy Spirit Center (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Our Lady of the Holy Spirit Center was the site of a building collapse, a radio station, and the 5th National Eucharistic Congress?

elements.title: Eschiva of Montbéliard (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Eschiva of Montbéliard left her children, fled to Buffavento Castle disguised as a monk, brought ample provisions, and joined an old knight in defending it?

elements.title: an upturned boat (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the most senior crew member of the Titanic to survive the disaster, as well as an American colonel, one of the telegraphists, the chief baker, and a teenage boy were all saved on an upturned boat?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

San Carlos de Bariloche

The Argentine adventure capital offers great opportunities for skiing, sightseeing, water sports, trekking and climbing amidst the amazing mountainous landscapes of Argentine Patagonia.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

Andorra la Vella

Andorra la Vella is the capital of a quirky co-principality lodged in the mountains between Spain and France that offers great skiing, hiking, and lots of duty-free shopping.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

Driving in China

China isn't one of the countries that foreigners commonly explore by driving themselves. If you'd still like to, the first step would be getting a local driving licence.
